ClinicalDocument.title: ePOLST: Resuscitation and Treatment Portable Medical Orders

text.paragraph: This is a medical order, not an advance directive. For information about POLST and to understand this document, visit: www.polst.org/form
Follow these orders if patient has no pulse and is not breathing.(Pick 1)

tr.td: YES CPR: Attempt Resuscitation, including mechanical ventilation, defibrillation and cardioversion. (Requires choosing Full Treatments in Section B)
NO CPR: Do Not Attempt Resuscitation. (May choose any option in Section B)

text.paragraph: Reassess and discuss interventions with patient or patient representative regularly to ensure treatments are meeting patientâ€™s care goals. Consider a time-trial of interventions based on goals and specific outcomes.
Follow these orders if patient has a pulse and/or is breathing. (Pick 1)

tr.td: Full Treatments (required if choose CPR in Section A). Goal: Attempt to sustain life by all medically effective means. Provide appropriate medical and surgical treatments as indicated to attempt to prolong life, including intensive care.)

Selective Treatments. Goal: Attempt to restore function while avoiding intensive care and resuscitation efforts (ventilator, defibrillation and cardioversion). May use non-invasive positive airway pressure, antibiotics and IV fluids as indicated. Avoid intensive care. Transfer to hospital if treatment needs cannot be met in current location.

Comfort-focused Treatments. Goal: Maximize comfort through symptom management; allow natural death. Use oxygen, suction and manual treatment of airway obstruction as needed for comfort. Avoid treatments listed in full or select treatments unless consistent with comfort goal. Transfer to hospital only if comfort cannot be achieved in current setting.

text.paragraph: These orders are in addition to those above (e.g., blood products, dialysis). [EMS protocols may limit emergency responder ability to act on orders in this section.]
Offer food by mouth if desired by patient, safe and tolerated. (Pick 1)

tr.td: Provide feeding through new or existing surgically-placed tubes
Trial period for artificial nutrition but no surgically-placed tubes
No artificial means of nutrition desired
Not discussed or no decision made (provide standard of care)

code.displayName: Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation Orders. Follow these orders if patient has no pulse and is not breathing.

value.displayName: YES CPR: Attempt Resuscitation, including mechanical ventilation, defibrillation and cardioversion.
NO CPR: Do Not Attempt Resuscitation.

code.displayName: Initial Treatment Orders. Follow these orders if patient has a pulse and/or is breathing.

value.displayName: Full Treatments (required if choose CPR in Section A). Goal: Attempt to sustain life by all medically effective means. Provide appropriate medical and surgical treatments as indicated to attempt to prolong life, including intensive care.

Selective Treatments. Goal: Attempt to restore function while avoiding intensive care and resuscitation efforts (ventilator, defibrillation and cardioversion). May use non-invasive positive airway pressure, antibiotics and IV fluids as indicated. Avoid intensive care. Transfer to hospital if treatment needs cannot be met in current location.

Comfort-focused Treatments. Goal: Maximize comfort through symptom management; allow natural death. Use oxygen, suction and manual treatment of airway obstruction as needed for comfort. Avoid treatments listed in full or select treatments unless consistent with comfort goal. Transfer to hospital only if comfort cannot be achieved in current setting.

code.displayName: Additional Orders or Instructions. These orders are in addition to those above (e.g., blood products, dialysis).
Medically Assisted Nutrition. Offer food by mouth if desired by patient, safe and tolerated.

value.displayName: Provide feeding through new or existing surgically-placed tubes.
Trial period for artificial nutrition but no surgically-placed tubes
No artificial means of nutrition desired.
Not discussed or no decision made (provide standard of care).
